doc.previous: Suppose F is an antiderivative of f, with f continuous on [a, b]. Let
doc.after: By the first part of the theorem, we know G is also an antiderivative of f. Since F' - G' = 0 the mean value theorem implies that F - G is a constant function, i. e. there is a number c such that G(x) = F(x) + c, for all x in [a, b]. Letting x = a, we have
